author: {'steamid': '76561198072690534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1705281146}
review:
Just completed first run, picking Hide at random, just for his looks. Not gonna lie, I"m happy with the ending I got.
However -
I'm pretty sure I've developed some serious face muscles thanks to all the eye-rolling and wincing. Protagonist may or may not have her heart in the right place; she definitely lacks brains though, and that's mildly speaking. No common sense, zero self-preservation instinct, with some serious masochistic urges instead.
Aside of the girl's (lack of) personality/wits/sanity, the story was amusing and the artwork was nice. I just don't have the kind of patience to put up with the protagonist any longer, so will not be checking out the other guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184023213', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1703624222}
review:
I really wanted to like this VN, but goodness gracious is the writing hot garbage. TFW you buy a game specifically for the older cast but they all act like teenagers anyway... Also the relationships are so rushed, it's hard to really give a shit about the romance or characters involved. And since there's really no plot aside for the romance, it becomes hard to stay engaged...

Stay strong ojicons, we will get a decent game eventually :'))

author: {'steamid': '76561198259338671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1638766957}
review:
I wanted to like this. There really isn't enough content with older romance candidates out there.

The candidates look older, but most act like younger characters. It feels to me like any other otome game (complete with tropes that are not my favorite) with a different coat of paint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255327710', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1695498306}
review: I forgot how much i enjoy this game xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198292204613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1600691744}
review:
One of the very rare Otome where you can date an Ojisan!
I recommend getting this game on sale, since its relatively short (i have a speedy reading tempo so dont take me as the standard).
Characters are diverse and likeable, but especially having an ojisan was fun!
Its a very low budget game, like one of those mobile Otome. But i do love it, be it a bit crusty. Worth to throw a few bucks and hours at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334489621', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1652064500}
review: I recommend this ON SALE. It scratched the itch I had for a game where I could romance older men. Was there depth to it? Not at all. Some of the characters have some real issues too. But, like I said, it satisfied what I was looking for. I bought it on sale for $8 though. I wouldn't recommend buying at full price. There's really nothing to justify the regular almost $20 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992635775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1688912752}
review:
Main story is very boring. It's always "he approached me oh he handsome i blush dokidoki" followed by "haha you blush so cute i like". Feels very much like a 7th grade girl's worst fan fiction.
I love handsome middle aged men, but the art/CG just isn't very good. Date scenario is nice, but it's really hard to enjoy it when the characters aren't likable. They act like horny teenage boys except that they're in a pub instead of high school cafeteria. Main girl also acts like a 14yo all the time. 

Overall, won't recommend. I'm a completionist and it's painful trying to finish every route. If you do wanna try, get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199162702258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1688219799}
review:
I tried very hard to like this game, and i mean this with ALL my heart here... you can just find better stories by randomly clicking on any wattpad fanfic.
Its not the oldness that puts me off or anything (thats actually why i was interested) its...like,everything around it,yeah i wasnt expecting much but its genuinely disappointing.i think i genuinely have trauma from some of these scenes.There were some really cute parts,but its surrounded by awful awful parts,so its kinda just not worth it at all.I dont think ive played anything else from the creators but i do hope they improved their writing skills with other games...

i think the best route i played was Yuze's, he had a decent amount of respect for the protagonist and they both got along quite nicely, but there were some really weird bad parts thrown in there that just...REALLY haunt me (why did they make a cg of the protagonist LICKING his mouth...lol,no offense to the artist,i know they moved on to make some really amazing art) it acts like its going to be a mature game.but its a mature game written for teenagers,i think.this just doesnt really feel all that "adult" in the ways it should,then again,i guess its hard to write for older characters when your so used to young adults and the like!
overall,get this on sale if your really curious,but i doubt your gonna actually complete the game (i had planned to 100% it,but i had to drop for my own sanity,and i can persevere through otome plots,hell,im an otome PRO lol and this still made me drop.really sad honestly) itd be cool to maybe see them make a remake or something,or maybe just another old man otome,i think id try it out...but yknow...doubt thats really gonna happen

author: {'steamid': '76561198054149762', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1681866558}
review:
I play a lot of otome games and have a pretty high tolerance for bad tropes and/or only okay writing, but I still can't recommend this one. I picked it up on a sale (which, if you're going to get it, is really the only way you should buy) and still feel like it wasn't totally worth the money.

The plots are boring and uninteresting, the MC is ridiculous, the men are predatory and not really attractive, and not even the sexy scenes can save it because they're also pretty tame and boring. Again, the only reason you should buy is on sale but even then, there's better out there for that money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110551336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2068, 'last_played': 1710270213}
review:
I agree with the many reviews about the bad writing and translation. A lot of this doesn't age well and the MC is a weak type that has no idea of what she's doing in life. As a woman I feel embarassed quite a lot because of her behavior. I'm happy I bought this on sale. I first came across this game when it was just released years ago in the Google Play store but never felt I wanted to pay for it back then and if it wasn't on sale this time I wouldn't have either. 

I am going to finish all routes and endings just because. The routes I liked best up until now is Kodama's and Soichiro's since they seem to have the most class for now. The Yorihisa route is disappointing imo and Mamoru's just plain unrealistic as a whole. Looking forward to Mr CEO Ryu's route in the hope it is the best one since it is the only one with a 2nd season. 

Buy this if you want some empty fun and only on sale. Also if you like the word 'saliva', they overuse it lol

review:
Nach 30 Stunden Spielzeit :D muss ich sagen, dass dieses Spiel echt scheiÃŸe ist. Ich hab ernsthaft alle Routen durch, am Anfang mit der Hoffnung, dass bestimmt eine davon interessant ist, but lol nope. Am Ende hab ich dann nur noch gespielt, weil man sich super mit Freunden drÃ¼ber lustig machen kann.
Das ganze Spiel ist voll mit Red Flags, irgendwelchen creepigen, over possesive alten SÃ¤cken, bei denen echt alle Alarmglocken schellen sollten. Dann ist die MC auch noch strunzendoof oder stÃ¤ndig schÃ¼chtern und peinlich berÃ¼hrt, auch wenn sie in einer Route schon dreimal gefickt haben.

Neben den uninteressanten Stories, wird hier eigentlich entweder nur gevÃ¶gelt (oh sorry 'Liebe gemacht' natÃ¼rlich) oder geheult, was echt super nervig war. Dazu kommt, dass die Kerle halt auch einfach unfassbar ugly sind - auch die CG Artworks sind einfach scheiÃŸ hÃ¤sslich. Haben Dogenza noch nie geile alte Kerle gesehen? Vorallem weil deren erstes Spiel mit den Nutten soviel schÃ¶nere Artworks hatten.

Ein positives hat es - alle anderen Otomes, die ich hiernach spiele, werden vermutlich besser sein :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199196519743', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1648780094}
review:
Dating middle aged men is fun and I now have unrealistic expectations for romance. Would've been nicer if the protagonist cried a little less; it made Yorihisa's story a little hard to enjoy.

Regardless, this was very good copium 10/10 (especially considering I spent $5!)

I will now wallow in sadness because Ryu and Hide aren't real. 
...but if they are, you know where to find me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043922820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1662548834}
review:
MC is a sexually repressed alcoholic that makes poor choices and instantly falls in ride-or-die love with the first guy that advances on her. There are some typos and grammar mistakes. Otherwise, I like the premise and the stories can be cute. There's 10 chapters per person, a date scenario and a sequel. One character gets a "season 2". There are extra side stories for 3 other characters separate from this. The choices don't really affect the story, they just unlock a different ending, which reads more like a slice-of-life chapter instead of distinct ending. 

The writing's not the best, but otome games are already slim pickings, and more so VNs with older men.

I chose the barkeep Soichiro first as a joke but he turned out to be my favorite route.

review: O jogo Ã© muito inovador, a ideia de namorar e se apaixonar por homens mais velhos Ã© sensacional. Estava particularmente cansada dessa visÃ£o de que os romances acabam aos 30, no mÃ¡ximo. O traÃ§o nÃ£o Ã© espetacular, a trilha sonora nÃ£o Ã© tÃ£o ampla, o formato das histÃ³rias se torna previsÃ­vel apÃ³s a primeira rota, mas apesar de tudo os personagens foram me cativando aos poucos. author: {'steamid': '76561199038438161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2398, 'last_played': 1628711400}
review:
[b][i]Pub Encounter[/i][/b] is typical [i]Dogenzaka Lab[/i] game. Take it or leave it. Personally, I think it is one of the better ones and I quite enyoyed it.

The game system is the same as in other [i]Dogenzaka Lab[/i] games: prologue, separate stories for 5 LI (+ 6th story of one LI as a 2nd season), good ending and best ending, date scenarios, sequels and several side stories. The whole game can be finished in about 35-37 hours.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Middle aged suitors.
+ Personalities and history of the characters.
+ Background music.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Translation. But you can live with it.
- Art. Sprites were good, but CGs were not my taste. Mostly close-up views of the faces.
- Romantic content was nice, but considering the set up, I would appreciate more of it.

Definitely wait for a discount and then enjoy this game.

review:
A hell of hangover game.
Most people would think dislike this game in terms of dating really old man with gap age of like 15y or more. This was not my problem with this game but what I will list below:

1. Very bad writing.  There are several gaps in the story, and while you would like to see here problems and issues found when people get old and life happens, you most likely to find very weak excuses, childish behaviour, and pure lack of interesting context overall.

2. Very submissive MC. There are two states for this MC, first, Absolutely accepting EVERYTHING "for love". (Please don't), and second, crying for everything. Absolutely everything and anything. 

3. This is not interactive at all.  MC talks a lot with herself, sometimes you feel like reading a book. The choices are very obvious and duo. Nothing else.

Positive points:
1. The art style for the game is good. 
2. You will learn a lot about the "hidden" meaning of drinks you will never ever try.

I do not recommend this game. However, if you want to try, it get some good discounts. ï½¡^â€¿^ï½¡

author: {'steamid': '76561198357060329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1635496259}
review:
There are a lot of problems with this game.

The Protag: 

She's extremely bland and makes a lot of really dumb choices. I get that she's supposed to be younger and therefore not as "wise" as the love interests (and even when I put it in quotations, I'm still using that word very generously), but there's a lot of choices she makes that go against basic common sense. On top of that, she has a lot of moments where she's extremely annoying. Just to name a few examples, she apologizes all the time for everything, she bursts into tears over everything, and she never stops being shy and embarrassed even after boning any of the love interests. "Yes, we've already had a few sex scenes in the game, but how dare you see me naked just now! I'll never live it down!" Maybe it's a cultural thing, I don't know, but it comes across as ridiculous. And of course, protags aren't always going to be perfect, but when you're the one who has to play that character, it can get exceptionally frustrating.

The Men:

Their routes range from the cliched "I could never love again... but true love wins!" to, "What the hell did I just read?!" Granted, the parts that land in the latter category are a lot more interesting so I've gotta give it that, but it's still one hell of a whiplash after a few routes have already given you the expectation that there's not going to be anything particularly remarkable about any of them.

Some of the men are very manipulative, which I guess isn't too much of a bad thing. After all, troubled relationships are a thing and you can't always expect these kinds of stories to end with the relationship being a perfectly healthy one. But, unfortunately, the protag never seems to understand when she's in a bad situation and should probably reconsider things. Once she wants the guy, come hell or high water, she's going to stay with the guy even when it's probably a bad idea. And that's just when it comes to the way they treat her.

Either way, you can expect the same formula with all of them. They flirt, they start to get close, drama happens, the man disappears for anywhere from a week to a month (think 3rd act breakup), the other men tell the protag to keep trying, they reunite, they lived happily ever after.

Some of the men are, however, not a bad choice so there's a decent mix of both.

Lots of Typos:

I understand when these games get translated there's usually going to be a few mistakes here and there. And that's fine. But then there are times when it's just inexcusable. For example, in Mamoru's route, there's a few times when they accidentally use the wrong name. Ex: ""Did you need anything?" I asked. "No thanks," Shiori said as he stood up." And no, that's not when the POV switched over to Mamoru. That was when it was still Shiori. And there are a lot of mistakes in general, making it very distracting.

The Music:

It's bad. That's all. Just bad.

Repetitive Writing:

The epilogues are the biggest culprits when it comes to this. These often drag on and often close out the route in a very clunky manner. There's usually at least one important plot point that will happen so it's not like skipping it is much of an option, but you have to get through a lot of repetitive dialogue and narration to get to it. And even then it'll often stretch past the point where it could have just ended. Other moments are either poorly translated or written and I'm honestly not sure which it is. There's moments where the characters will have professed their love for each other, and then in the next breath claim they don't know how the other feels about them. Or they'll react to a love confession as though it's the first time they've heard it even though it was already said earlier.

All of that said, I can't say I fully hated the game. At the very least, I wanted to get to the end of some of the routes because I genuinely wanted to know what happened. Others I kinda slogged through as a matter of principle. But at the same time I can't really recommend it. If you really want to give this game a try, I'd advise waiting for it to be on sale at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219473597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1686176191}
review:
Easily one of my favorite visual novels by Dogenzaka Lab. You don't usually get novels strictly about dating older men and I thoroughly appreciated the change from same-age-range romances. I really loved that the story takes age-gap factors into consideration, depending on which love interest you choose, and I'm certain this would appeal greatly to anyone that doesn't see age as a "deal breaker".

Each route is pleasantly distinguishable from another, there are virtually no typos or grammar issues (HECK YES!), and I have happily played this over a few times. ;) 

10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121825416', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1618008056}
review:
Among all the Dogen games I've played -see reviews- this one was one of the "Not bad" ones.

I don't know if it is a character thing, or it is because I'm close to 30 right now, all the other games with young, energetic LI's were quite tiring for me. Even though the story and the LI's in here are definitely NOT perfect, pacing and the level of maturity was a pleasant change for me.

MC is I guess around her early or mid 20's looking at how LIs keep emphasizing the youth and the age gap. Although she is shallow half the time and quick to fall in love without knowing the smallest thing about the LI, she was one of the most assertive ones I've seen up until this point (though I'm quite new to this genre).

Given that I wouldn't be considered as a young adult or fresh youth at the nice and ripe age of 28(lol), I found LIs -apart from Soichiro- were quite charming compared to other games I've played. I'm not judging if you're into way-way-older men, but honestly, I just played Soichiro's route so fast that it could be a new speed reading record on my side. It was quite creepy, to be honest. Although apart from his route, he is a quite charming old man you can easily chat as a bartender or an acquaintance. Most people in the reviews mentioned Yorihisa and Mamoru being manipulative. Yorihisa was manipulative all right, especially at the end of his route I was appalled by what was in the box he gave to the MC. Even though he doesn't explicitly -as far as I remember- do it, he compares MC with someone from the past. Ryunosuke has the most stable route I guess. He is shy and not very comfortable with women, quite understandably considering some things he experienced. Hideaki has a sad story but boi his route is fast-paced and underdeveloped. I would love to have a longer and well-written Hideaki route instead of a needless 2nd season of Ryunosuke honestly. Mamoru didn't strike me as a manipulative one but an exaggerated version of a PLAYA with a big ego (he accepts his ego is massive) and since I'm quite an avid Yakuza fan, his story piqued my interest a lot (He is also the youngest - and one of the types I liked design-wise). Like Hideaki, I would love to see a more detailed version of his story too because it was short and fast-paced too. 

The artworks were quite good, but there is an inconsistency between them regarding MC's eyes. Like, in one artwork she has eyes, in the other, she doesn't have them. In some of them, her facial features, in general, are extremely vague. Other than that, similar to other Dogen titles I've played, 3 of the characters have the same face model with little tweaks. I don't expect them to be extremely different from each other, but they are too similar. Music was repetitive, but most of the time it was a smooth melody, so I've just decreased it while playing.

Personally, I liked the game. Is it perfect? Nah. It is a cheap, smutty, otome game that has characters whose behaviors would definitely be problematic one way or another in a normal society. But compared to the ones I've played up until this point, I've enjoyed this one. I would recommend buying IF it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199117975314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1699908097}
review:
[h1] My overall review: [/h1]
I have very mixed feelings about this game. I enjoyed it very much and it was without a doubt my favorite out of Dogenzaka Labs, but it shares every fault that comes with the title. I would advise you to buy it only from a sale.

In so many instances the characters defined what a woman is, what a man is not, making me feel like I'm having a conversation with my grandfather. Those moments, and some more similar views, were most of what my annoyance came from.

The rest of this review will contain spoilers.

[b] The MC [/b]
She was bold, didn't have a problem pursuing the guy she liked, flirted, and admitted her feelings with ease. I was really surprised by her openness and eagerness.

The biggest problem was whenever the guy of the route touched her without her consent, refusing to stop despite her protests, she excused his actions, saying, "this is okay if it's going to help/make him believe me."

Another thing I hate is when the guys make disrespectful jokes about her because they consider it 'teasing,' it's usually framed as flattering, so all she does is blush in response.

[b] The Story [/b]
The MC discovers a pub named Audire. This happens the first thing you start the prologue, so you don't deal with anything that doesn't play around the guys.

Most of the backstories weren't handled nicely. Dogenzaka Lab has a way that never changes. [i]The MC realizes her feelings, things happen, casually unwrapping backstories without much thought, confession, and happy ending.[/i] 

Each of the guys has a Tragicâ„¢ backstory, which makes them closed off to the MC at first. But of course, she sticks her nose into their business and learns all about their problems. After this, pretty much everything turns out okay. In some of the routes, the guy has to face his past, but usually, just after he shares his problem with the MC, he heals.

[b] The Guys [/b]
A few of them harassed the MC without much remorse, very Dogenzaka of them. Despite that, they also seemed to respect MC better and more realistically than most other Dogenzaka guys do to their MCs.

It was refreshing for them to all simply like MC without an ulterior motive, and each other too.  They were often nice to her and bonded over common things. No matter whose route you were playing, they were helpful and encouraging.

I listed the routes from my best to worst.

Soichiro Toyoizumi
His brother is financially dependent on him, which results in a messy dynamic between himself, his brother, and the MC. His relationship with the MC is quite sweet and fun. they truly bonded and worked together.

He was a little frustrating to get through at times. Early on, he saves MC from an assault and reassures her that she has nothing to apologize for and it wasn't her fault, that's good. Later, both he and his brother harass the MC, not to the same degree, but it felt very tone-deaf.

Mamoru Arashiro (43)
Quite the misogynist here. He had connections to some yakuza and after he quit, it began to haunt him. A woman, who allegedly encouraged him to leave, committed suicide after he left so the man who loved her wanted revenge. He looked good in a suit.

Yorihisa Hodo (51)
He's a writer both you and Ryu like. He uses this as leverage to start a bet with you. Whoever falls in love first loses.

His story is that his wife and daughter died. When MC learns that, she suspects he's being close to her because she resembles his wife, which he confirms, so the MC gets upset, rightfully. Later, he gives MC a dress that belonged to his late wife as a part of his act of love.

Hideaki Kodoma (46)
His relationship with the MC starts quite sweet, both of them eager to develop something. His backstory was heavy but dealt with like an afterthought. It's obvious he's traumatized by it but the only thing he shows is his stress and he heals really quickly once MC gets involved. The writing in his route was a little awkward and strangely rushed as well.

Ryunosuke Yuze (41)
In his main story, you deal with his stalker, who attacks you and him. As a result of trauma, he doesn't trust women. He does say he's wrong to think that way, but he has some lines regarding "women are evil but you're not like other girls."

In his second season, you deal with a man that hates him and wants to steal you. He loses his company and together, you try to get it back.
 
His route is more focused on the plot compared to the others, and the romance is the least steamy, although somewhat more explicit. He was a nice and gentle guy overall, but I'm listing him low because I found his story to be quite dull, and the writing awkward. Despite their nice gestures, MC was distanced from other guys too. Ryu was a little cold toward them in a way he wasn't in others' routes.

[h1] Summary [/h1]
If the concept interests you, I definitely recommend giving it a go. I like the characters and the story, and the general atmosphere created is nice too: a pub and its welcoming regulars there to comfort you. Once the guys open their mouths, it's a very rocky road and may be frustrating to experience. If you're familiar with Dogenzaka games, you know the problems they usually have.
 
Minoru should definitely have been a route.

review: This game is a masterpiece. It has a great story and it didn't bother me at all that the characters are older than the usual. Every character is charming in their own ways. I couldn't pick a favorite story, because I equally liked all of them. I found only one little bug in the game. It's not annoying, but I noticed it. In Yuze's season 2 chapter 2 or chapter 3 Yuze's cloths are changing. Once Yuze is wearing a red jacket, then he wears a black suit, and these two clothes changes at every sentence. But it stops after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063314930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1609904889}
review:
One of the worst otome games I've ever played. Main character's dialog is a lot of apologizing and stammering. The guys are the absolute worst part though, and most are extremely creepy. Their age doesn't factor into this, but rather their dialog and behavior. Several would be an HR department's worst nightmare.

Plot lines also fall short. For example, in some routes the game mentions they go on a date together, but then the scene skips to after the date and the text just notes they had fun... Very little actual relationship build-up, so it's difficult to understand why the character might suddenly fall 'in love'.

Save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561199098416568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1612826021}
review:
I agree with what another reviewer said about not going into this game with super elevated expectations.  It is a basic, fairly sweet, occasionally steamy VN. The love interests seem to be fleshed out a lot better than the MC, which I suppose was deliberate on the part of the developers.  However, I felt left wanting to know more about Shiori other than the fact she likes to read, cook, and gets ridiculously over-the-top embarrassed at nudity and sex talk, so much so that one would think she'd been a nun in a past life.  Part of me was unsure why all these urbane, accomplished men were so taken by her other than the fact that she was a pretty young thing who happened to show up at their sausage-fest bar one day. 

So, while not overly compelling, it was cute and a pretty enjoyable way to pass some time. I'd recommend picking it up next time you see it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051194674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1608667490}
review: The game I played previously by Dogenzaka Lab was pretty badly translated and rapey, so I didn't have very high hopes for this game. However, it turned out to be pretty sweet. One route didn't work for me (although I might try it again later), but the two I did play were romantic and sexy. The game is pretty much what it says in the description, so obviously, if you don't want to romance older guys, you shouldn't buy it. However, I think that even if I dislike the other routes, the two that I played will be enough to make the game worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279016066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1609744778}
review:
I've been non-stop playing this game during the last two weeks of my life, it's been an experience.

From what I've seen, it's pretty polarizing, either you absolutely love it, or you despise it with your whole being, although there are rare middle-grounds. I adore this game, it's made me laugh out loud because of it's so over the top, but also I've felt very attached to some characters *cough* Mamoru and Hide *cough*. I'm honestly not that experienced with visual novels, I tend to lean to Nitro+Chiral stuff (BL), and the only proper otome I've played is Mystic Messenger so this review is from the perspective of a very occasional visual novel player. 

Also I have a pretty big thing for old 2D men, especially if they're DILFs, so this caters specifically to me, minus the dad part, but anyways they're still old, hot anime men~

But even I must warn about some stuff inside this game, there are some technical issues and some stuff that can be triggering for some people, I actually wanted to recommend this game to someone, but when they asked me if it had some triggers, I couldn't omit some stuff from some routes, and they decided not to play it for their mental health.

The writing is very over the top, but I don't think it would be wise to buy a game named "Pub Encounter: Forbidden Romance" thinking it's a game you should take seriously, I personally had a blast because I was very aware of its potential writing flaws, and I got exactly what I was expecting, making me satisfied. This game is very clichÃ© and requires a big suspension of disbelief, so if you're into liking stuff ironically or like "bad", clichÃ© romance stories I would totally recommend this game. You can easily predict the plot most of the time, but if you like a ride to a predictable, yet entertaining path for pure self-indulgence is very good. In some routes you bang a lot and in some others not so much; but you'll end up banging every romanceable option at some point in the story.

Although Mamoru and Hideaki's routes were the most fast-paced, I got really attached to the characters because they hit all of my husbando boxes (and also have beards) and they have angsty pasts, so I'm soft. I wanna marry Mamoru, the lawyer with a dangerous past and I wanna hug Hide and tell him everything is ok. They are the closest to each other and appear in each other's routes way more than the rest and they get the most worried about each other and are almost always hanging out together so my headcanon is that they're best friends and now ship them with my whole soul, so I'm starving for content *cries* 
Ryu is the sweetest one, Soichiro the most mature and realistic (to the extent of possible within this novel), and Yorihisa is kinda... the manipulative one. 
The MC is kinda dumb at times and her personality is weak, but she shines the most and is very bold on Ryu's route. I'm assuming is like that for the easier the self-projection that kind of bland character has, so I can't really judge her for being written like that. She's in her 20's and I'm currently 20, so from my perspective she's kinda there, but reminds me more of my younger self at times, but she acts like generally like a young adult, a mildly naive adult. She's not really embarrassed by sex, and I heard that most MCs in other games are more childish in that regard so I can relate to her in that aspect because is rare to be embarrassed by it as an adult.

The music is cool and smooth; it has few tracks but they work pretty well. The looping is not perfect, but to the point of feeling distracting or bothersome. This game doesn't have voice acting, and I'm salty about that because the characters (at least the main five) do have official voices because there is a CD drama (yes I'm that deep into this, help). My favorite voices are Mamoru and Hide (I wonder why haha), Mamoru is Rikiya Koyama, and he also voices Shinjuro Rengoku, my current supreme husbando so I'm losing my mind; and Hide is the same VA as Muzan Kibutsuji (sorry, I don't remember his name), and his acting is awesome because his voice adapts so well to Hide, he has great versatility.

I'm an art student, so the sprites and CGs made me suffer a little, but I appreciated the vibe. I liked the backgrounds, although they sometimes had whack perspective, but you can ignore that if you don't really focus on it. The CGs made me wince a little sometimes, the coloring was kinda inconsistent technique-wise and the anatomy was sorta ok, I guess... eh. The artist seemed not to be that experienced drawing older men, the faces are a bit odd, but you can guess easily what type of design feel they were aiming at. Tbh the prettiest (and better drawn character) is Mamoru, but he's my favorite so I'm happy with him. 
I wish they had drawn more character sprites, there were many side characters that appeared constantly in their respective routes depending on the guy you chose that didn't have a sprite (only the main five love interests and Minoru, the gossip grandpa, have sprites) so it was lacking in that regard.

About the triggers, I've seen a lot of people hating on Mamoru because he has some consent issues the first time you bang with him, I considered that scene dub-con because I've read way worse things *coughs in Nitro+Chiral*, but later when you bang, the MC is all the way into it. I didn't really mind about that issue because he's cute and doesn't exist and I'm aware this is a very unrealistic story, but I know some people can't stand that stuff. Another thing is that they call him a manipulator, but I think is really mild compared to what happens in Yorihisa's route, like he's THE manipulator of the game but I don't wanna spoil; his relationship with MC is especially unbalanced and that can also be a turn-off for some. There are other routes that deal with PTSD because of childhood trauma with non-specific nor graphic child abuse, so have that in mind. Another route deals with stalkers, but is mild compared to other media I've seen. 

So, in synthesis, I really like this game despite its many flaws because I knew exactly what to expect from it, and it has made me pass great laughs are heart-fell moments through this self-isolation times, I felt happier in my daily life during these two weeks because I was genuinely invested in this wacky game. 
I would say, buy it if you like this stuff, but wait for a discount.

Now I'mma replay Mamo and Hide's routes and cry while I draw and write MamoHide for my own consumption, sorry if post too much in the art section bc it's almost deserted now and I need to see Mamoru and Hide on a date bye <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198928289350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1601508349}
review:
I like that the writers were trying to include more diverse LIs, but my goodness, what the heck is wrong with the character designs? The sprites are okay for the most part, but some of the CGs are TERRIFYING! Especially poor Soichiro, who looks a few days past 100 in his.

Besides Ryunosuke (first season), I didn't really find the routes that interesting or attention-worthy. Soichiro is sweet (BUT OLD), Yorihisa is a jackass, Hideaki is sweet and goofy, and Mamoru has probably been slapped with several sexual harassment suits. MC is a supreme idiot in Mamoru's route which was upsetting.

The stories are pretty short and mostly cliche; the protagonist is yet another nameless, faceless girl in her twenties struggling in a boring office job and lacking any sort of back story, motivations, or ambitions for her future (except somewhat in Ryunosuke's route). 

Overall, my expectations were too high, even for a game called "Pub Encounter" or "Dandy Shot" in the original Japanese. I overall DO NOT recommend this game; however, it may be worth buying on sale just for sweet Ryu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418411585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1629570683}
review: I had this game a while back and saw it was on offer and bought it. There's not much to complain about this game as its everything you would expect from an otome game. If I had to say improvements maybe give the players more of a choice in how the story goes. Also, she's living the dream in this story, but some of the lines from this game are just too cheesy lol idk i was taken aback. But overall its a good game. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198053344065', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1602910677}
review:
Bad writing. Bland characters. Unappealing sprites. Premise was interesting but what an horrendous execution. 

Gems from this game:

-"His possessiveness warmed my heart."
-"I just thought I'd give you a mark to brand you as mine."
-"Be quiet! I can't help how possessive I get!"
-"Try and remember that you belong to me for once."
-"You looked so lovely when you were sleeping I started wanting to attack you again."

And that's just from ONE route. Characters come across as possesive, needy jerks. Tried to go for a second love interest route and couldn't take the cringe. Like... "Yorihisa then began trailing his tongue over my palm, deliberately noisily." Really? Is that supposed to be sexy? 

This game doesn't even reach bad fanfiction level of writing. Do something better with your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318172864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1626395892}
review:
I normally wouldn't review a VN so early, but the Summer Sale is almost over, so... If you can snap this up for the current sales price of $6.29 USD it's a steal. I only completed the Soichiro route so far, and I'm getting through Ryunosuke, but it's nice to see a otome with older men for a change. The writing is better than My Secret Pets was, and the mc can stand up for herself, at least on the routes I've played.

I'm honestly not sure why so many people insisted on buying it only to harsh on it. If you don't like older guys, don't read it. The mc is certainly old enough to drink in a bar and hold down an office job, so she's old enough to know what kind of guys she wants to date.

UPDATE: AS I finish the story routes, I'll give brief recap here:

Toyoizumi Soichiro: The owner of the pub, and probably the kindest man in the otome. He's reluctant to commit his heart, but once he does, it will be forever. He's romantic and old-fashioned, and although there is passion in him, it doesn't appear in his route right away. I liked Soichiro the best, as he treated the main character like a lady and behaved like a proper gentleman, well, for the most part.

Yuze Ryunosuke: His route can have a rather wonderful ending, but our poor leading lady will put up with a lot to get there. Yuze can be kind of a jerk at times, tender and loving at others. Though he will be the first to defend the mc if it isn't his route, so it's clear he does respect women, and he does treat her decently. His attitude towards women makes sense given his past, but he can seem cold and aloof at times.

Hodo Yorihisa: I honestly wondered if he truly loved the mc at all at some points. He tricks her into dating him, which admittedly isn't too hard once she finds out who he is, then uses a prize to get her to stay in the relationship. In the end he really does love her, and given his backstory his actions, though a bit cruel, are understandable. He at least tries to level the playfield a bit at times, so there is kindness in him.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165536927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1583773851}
review:
There's a lot of good reviews for this game, but this isn't one of them. However, I explain why I feel that way. I'll put a tl;dr at the end with pros and cons.

When I first saw this game, I was happy to see something with older characters. Most otome's/dating sims/visual novels have high school or college age people getting together. 
While I still like the concept of the guys being middle aged, they should've been a decade or two younger... I'm not sure most of these guys are 'middle aged' anymore.
In Japan, this might be an acceptable thing, but in many countries it's frowned upon for there to be THIS much of an age difference unless the old guy is rich and keeping the younger woman in luxury (read: sugar daddy).

The protagonist is clearly in her early- to mid-20's. She's so naive, I'd lean more towards early 20's (if not flat out 18 or 19). For the purposes of my review, I'm assuming she's 20.
Fine, whatever, dating sims are aimed towards women and many are that age. 
However, these guys are old enough to be her father or grandfather. The youngest guy is 41, and the two oldest don't even have their ages mentioned. She really should be around 30 for this to be cute instead of pedophilic. Is this a dating sim or a lolita sim?

I'll admit to being charmed by two of the routes, which happened to be the second youngest and one that seems to be the oldest though his age isn't specified, but it's not worth the price for two enjoyable routes.
I was bored in most of them. It's definitely a Slice-of-Life sort of game, but it doesn't do it particularly well, and I'm a fan of Harvest Moon and Story of Seasons.

Your character hates her job and has no personality until she meets the guys (can't even call them 'boys' at this point), then her personality changes based on what they want. 
The emphasis is largely on making the guys like you, which isn't uncommon in this type of game, but I wonder why a woman so young would be charmed by men her father's age (daddy issues perhaps?) 
I also see no reason the men should be interested in her, besides the fact that she's young and cute. 

It doesn't go in-depth into the men's backgrounds or why they are the way they are, and when they do mention it, it's like a short, dissatisfying explanation that just blankets over their issues.
Every route has its own conflict that the 'couple' struggles with for most of the route, and most of them are resolved in a way that makes sense, however one of the guy's conflict is resolved way too quickly, especially due to the type of conflict it is.

TL;DR
Pros:
It's different

Cons:
Age difference is huge
Characters are too generic
Protagonist has no personality
Protagonist too young
Most routes are boring
Feels like pedophilia at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027322452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1583038673}
review:
I loved this game from the moment I read the summary. How unique! 
After playing through half of the routes I can say this is definitely a fun game with characters I really like. I'm looking forward to finishing the rest of them, too! 
Everyone is so friendly and being surrounded by a bunch of attractive older men who want to be nice to me makes me very happy lol. 
I like that it deals with realistic issues, too. The passing of a spouse, a history of being stalked, family fights, etc. It was so interesting!
One thing I will say against it though, is that there are quite a few grammatical and spelling errors. If that could be fixed in an update, I'd be even happier!
As it stands, though: I liked it for the great interactions, the lovely art, and the way it made my heart race! I can't wait to finish this game to 100%!

author: {'steamid': '76561198860397279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1627, 'last_played': 1592534801}
review: I really enjoyed this game. Younger woman falls for older guy. Each of the male leads has a hidden secret that is revealed as each of their stories draws to a conclusion. Play both the best and good endings so you can see the subtle ending changes. No bad endings to be found. My least favorite was Soichiro only because some of his scenes looked a little "creepy" vs. sexy, but his background story is worth reading his route.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024096210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1708790872}
review:
Gleich zu Anfang mÃ¶chte ich eine Warnung an trockene Alkoholiker stellen.
Finger weg von diesem Spiel! Ich trinke nicht, hatte aber nach relativ kurzer Spielzeit den unwiederstehlichen  Gusto auf den einen oder anderen Cocktail - und das ist kein Witz.

Die zweite Warnung geht an sehr junge Spieler/innen.
Spart euch das Geld, das Game wird euch nicht gefallen. Wer hÃ¤ngt schon im echten Leben blutjung mit Ã¤lteren MÃ¤nnern herum, wenn nicht rein finanzielle Interessen dahinter stehen?
Ich habe im Leben noch keinen Fall erlebt.

Dritte Warnung. 
Vermeidet es mÃ¶glichst, wÃ¤hrend sich die Geschichte entwickelt, auf die wirklich grauenhafte Grafik zu sehen. Sie ist wie ein Verkehrsunfall. Schrecklich anzusehen, und trotzdem guckt man immer wieder hin.
Also lasst es lieber!
Schaltet statt dessen lieber euer Kopfkino ein, und stellt euch z.B. einen Schauspieler vor, der im Alter der mÃ¤nnlichen Protagonisten des Spiels ist. Also zwischen 40 und 50.

Es schÃ¼ttelt dich bei der Vorstellung vor SO ALTEN MÃ¤nnerm?
Na dann schau dir z.B. einen Patrick Dempsey, er ist Ã¼ber 45 und echt heiss.
Oder "The Rock" Dwayne Johnson, Bradley Cooper, Gerard Butler usw...
Alles keine grÃ¼nen Jungs mehr, aber heiss wie die HÃ¶lle.
Denk also an solche Typen, und vergiss die potthÃ¤sslichen Grafiken.

Und nun endlich zum Spiel?
Jein - mir persÃ¶nlich gefiel die musikalische Untermalung gar nicht. Nicht mein Geschmack.
Also habe ich die Musik im Spiel abgedreht, und statt dessen auf YouTube nach Musik gesucht, die ich gerne in einer Bar hÃ¶ren wÃ¼rde. Es gibt da echt tolle Aufnahmen. Zum Beispiel Piano-Musik von einer Stunde und mehr. Passt (fÃ¼r mich) perfekt.

Und jetzt zum Spiel ... endlich wird der ermÃ¼dete Leser seufzen.
Halt durch, es lohnt sich.

Man kann der weiblichen Hauptfigut einen persÃ¶nlichen Namen geben.
Finde ich gut, zieht mich ein bischen mehr in die Geschichte hinein.

Frau ist am Heimweg von einem Job als SekretÃ¤rin der sie nervt und ermÃ¼det, und landet auf der Suche nach etwas Ablenkung in der Bar Audire. 
Dort trifft sie auf vier MÃ¤nner und den Besitzer der Bar, die Ã¼ber den weiblichen Gast mehr als erfreut sind. 
Soweit die Vorgeschichte. Ab da lernt man dann in jedem Kapitel das aus acht Teilen besteht die MÃ¤nner einzeln nÃ¤her kennen.

Das MÃ¤nner Ã¼ber vierzig eine interessante Lebengeschichte haben (kÃ¶nnen) ist klar. Diese vier und der Barbesitzer haben interessante Geschichten, die von der weiblichen Hauptfigur erforscht werden. Je nachdem wie man Entscheidungen trifft, endet es mit einem guten oder sehr guten Ende. VÃ¶lliges Verlieren gibt es nicht.

Ein bischen FingerspitzengefÃ¼hl und eigene Lebenserfahrung sind beim LÃ¶sen der fÃ¼nf FÃ¤lle hilfreich.
Ich persÃ¶nlich habe in meinem Leben schon den einen oder anderen Typ aus dem Audire kennen gelernt, und kann bestÃ¤tigen das es keine hanebÃ¼chenen Erfindungen sind, die beschrieben werden. Leben eben, mit seinen Sonnen- und Schatten Seiten. Im Game mehr die Schatten Seiten, denn die MÃ¤nner sitzen nicht ohne Grund jede Nacht in der bar und knallen sich die Birne mehr oder weniger zu.

Negativ bewerte ich die relativ wenigen Entscheidungen die man treffen kann,
und das manche Entscheidung im Spiel abgeschwÃ¤cht oder uminterpretiert wird. Das sind FuÃŸangeln die unnÃ¶tig sind.

Negativ sollte ich auch das Benehmen der weiblichen Hauptfigur in manchen Situationen bewerten. Bin damit allerdings vorsichtig, das es wohl der japanischen Vorstellung von weiblich entspricht, wenn Frau schnell errÃ¶tet, verlegen den Kopf senkt, oder in TrÃ¤nen ausbricht. Das akzeptiere ich einfach mal so.

Wenig gefallen hat mir die Geschichte mit dem Barbesitzer Soichiro. Bei ihm hat mir mein Kopfkino nicht geholfen, obwohl ich fÃ¼r meine Fantasie eigentlich VergnÃ¼gungssteuer bezahlen mÃ¼sste.
Der Typ ist (fÃ¼r mich) langweilig und betont zu oft, das er der Ã„lteste ist. Auch wenn ich einen Sean Connery im fortgeschrittenen Alter fÃ¼r hot hielt, Soichiro konnte er nicht ausblenden. Seine Geschichte habe ich bischer nicht beendet. Ob ich mich dazu noch aufraffe? Vielleicht nach drei bis vier KirschlikÃ¶r ...

Ob ich das Spiel empfehle?
Ja - ausser fÃ¼r trockene Alkoholiker, oder allgemein Menschen mit einem Alkohol Problem.
Ich habe keines. 
Also werde ich mich jetzt wieder in die angenehme AtmosphÃ¤re von Audire begeben
und meinen Favoriten Manoru treffen. Das einem Bad Boys aber auch immer so anziehen mÃ¼ssen Ts-ts-ts.
Einen Cocktail habe ich nicht zur hand, aber ein GlÃ¤schen KirschlikÃ¶r (passend zu Japans Liebe zu KirschenblÃ¼ten) tutÂ´s ja auch. Cheers und viel VergnÃ¼gen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055580783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2004, 'last_played': 1573760966}
review:
If you are looking for poorly written smut feat older men, look no further. I originally played this game on Iphone but the pc version is much cheaper and gives you all the routes, its also available on switch.
Over the top and over dramatic to the max, its main appeal are the maturity of the characters.
It is not high quality by any means (in fact its painfully obvious where corners were cut) but its a light read, and is very much like one of those enjoyable but poorly written romance novels you read as a teen.

I am still working my way through them all but pro tip: Mamoru is def one of the dirtier routes.
For some reason Yuze is the only character given a season 2. While it is unlikley I would like to see the other characters get second seasons as well.

Overall I would say the concept is there but the product is less then stellar. That said, I'd still recomend this one if your an adult with an otome addition!!

review: I absolutely loved this game. It was so immersive and had a lovely story. I loved how different and unexpected each character's arc was. This is not your run of the mill otome. LOVED IT. <3 My favorite route was Yorihisa Hodo's route.

review: I haven't played much otome games, and those I tried made me feel embarassed about their story and dialogues. Honesly, this one gives me the same impression at times. Nonetheless, can we all appreciate its concept?! Jesus, look at the barkeeper, I never bought a game so instantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308915235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1584, 'last_played': 1557072043}
review:
Pub Encounter has a interesting story. Just personally, just not worked out as well as I hope it would be.
To me, the game seems too rushed (special few characters). The background-story and the effect that's it has on the men, need to be more on the foreground. I do dislike the fact the MC has no real backbone and sometimes no common sense.
Yes, I get MC is the loving and supporting MC, but it's depressing to read; every time something go's wrong on her job, she go's to the bar. Not trying to really work on herself or maybe try something else to be better.

The game is clear not for young (or immature) audience. 16+ at least i belief. There will be some darker themes in the story. As life was not kind to your men. But again, for me personally, need more work on that part and effect of it on the characters. 

To me the game was simply not interesting , more boring if i'm honest. The bland MC and characters just didn't make it interesting enough. Really, Ryunoske route, was painful for me to finish, MC and Ryu where too bland. I really was thinking lot of the time; 'what does she/he see in the other?'; because really what is there to love with such a shallow connection/relationship? I do say that Mamoru makes it lots better with his story.

At least the art is good. Clear and nice enough to look at. The music was plus. Really like that music sound.
If you want to buy the game, do it at least when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091810387', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5191, 'last_played': 1623976477}
review:
Best otome I've ever played. I love these middle aged men so much!!!
The love they grow/have for the MC is so sweet and genuine and it has the perfect amount of saucey moments initiated by both the romanced character and the MC. 
Originally bought this as a joke but now this is all i care about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129409637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1553455926}
review:
The review by rubynxt is spot on so I'm not going into a lot of detail. I started Yorihisa and Mamoru's routes but couldn't finish them. Yorihisa is full of himself and manipulative and the MC is a gullible stuttering shy mess. I stopped early in Mamoru's route. He is an obvious flirt but actually seemed like a good guy in the other guys routes and has really helped them out and was a good friend... aaand then he's pawing all over you the day after you first met and barely spoke to him, gets you drunk, says he's falling in love with you and sleeps over in your bed uninvited when you black out, teases you about messing with you while you were blacked out.. and I stopped playing his route. Eugh... 
The romance scenes are mostly awkwardly written with one CG per route (best one is probably in Ruynosuke's route), it is one of those stories where the MC is pursued by everyone for no apparent reason, and there is a lot of waxing poetically/sappy internal monologuing at times. I mostly laughed at the corny or silly writing and not because it was actually funny. It can be hard to follow who is saying what at times. Probably best to buy on sale. It is ok just don't take it too seriously and avoid those two routes.

Suggested Route order:
Avoid Yorihisa (smug SOB with a green shirt) and avoid Mamoru (Red haired boorish frat creep)

1. Ryunosuke (glasses and suit) - typical kind of route but pleasant with some serious subject matter but it isn't really addressed. The guy is nice and actually a bit shy which can be refreshing.
2. Hideaki (eyebrow scar) - pretty serious subject matter that is very focused on and MC is tearful a lot but they have a pretty good connection even if it is really fast to develope.
3. Shoichiro (older bar tender) - slow burn relationship that is almost too slow at points but thought out at the same time and the most enjoyable I think. The most normal really and nice to leave off on a good note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198817619161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1568061482}
review:
I wasn't quite sure if I wanted to play this game in the first place when one of my friends' younger sibling suggested it to me, the reason for that is because I'm not particularly interested dating guys in their 60s or 40s plus it seems super weird to me because it feels like dating your grandâ€“dad or uncle....

However, each of the characters has their own story line which is pretty good, I did enjoy the background story but I think It's bit too fast to have a relationship and the sexual scenes, it's really straight forward to the point of this game, but I guess this is what otome games suppose to be like or I could be wrong Idk? The illustration of the characters is good but maybe it's a good idea to have a few more background for different scenes rather than having the same ones for all the characters?

Overall, the game is good but I think I still wouldn't date any of them in the reality to be fair, I think it's just not my thing ğŸ˜‚ but I do respect whoever wants to or the opposite of me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230877204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5675, 'last_played': 1613772002}
review:
fun characters, good art, fun music, good and fun routes and a lot of fun sexy time.  

Hideaki was a sad/fun sweetheart that you just wanna hug.
Mamoru a sexy bad boy with a dramatic rich character.
Ryunoske is my favorite and i thought he was gonna be all cool and grown up, but no he is an absolute cutie.
Soichiro is a silver fox well worth the wait!
they only thing i didn't like was Yorihisa. he was very nice and fun when you played someone elses route but when you played his he felt....emotionally abusive? manipulative? i just never felt any love from him, which is a shame since everyone elses routes was so fun. 

i really fell in love with this game and its characters, i highly recomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052260151', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1610947186}
review:
While this VN is clearly not as "shelled out" as some other titles, I think it is certainly still worth the purchase ( especially while it is on steam sale for only $6! ). 

I want to start my review by saying that if you go into this game comparing it to big titles like Amnesia, or Hakuouki then you are going to be disappointed. This VN ceratinly would fall into more of what I would expect that you would see on a mobile phone. ( Reminds me of the Shall We Date? series ). The routes are only going to run you about 1 hour to an 1 hour and a half max, and the places you go/elements of the story are certainly more limited in comparison to some other VN's but for this particular title I really think that it just works.

Pub Encounter is a more mature take on a VN, especially when it comes to a VN that is marketed towards female audiences, and this fact alone is one of the reasons that this seemingly more like a mobile VN has become one of my all time favorite VN's. 
The suitors in this game are a bit older ( I believe ranging from 30's up? ) and the issues that the game deals with can be much darker or 'realistic' if you will than other VN's. This may turn some users away, but if you are tired of romancing the same type of immature characters in VN's this will be a breath of fresh air for you. 

The stories I have gone through in the game so far are very emotional, and as I said contain some darker story elements than some other VN's. This game feels a lot more realistic in that regard, and for some that may take away the appeal of the VN. However, for me I really truly loved that aspect about this game. Hideaki's route was really emotional for me, and for that route alone I would reccomend this game. I also absolutely love the art that has been used for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305645851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1533263213}
review:
[h1]â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €Welcome to Audire, my dear.[/h1]
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €This is an Otome game where you can romance middle aged men.
â €â €Make fun all you want, but hey, this is a VN. I don't know what else you would expect.

Compared to the other Dogenzaka Lab games I have played, this one, in my opinion is the least cancer! This one is still VERY cheesy and cringe but their other ones are just AWFUL! I want to say that I recommend playing them to get your own opinion on them, but be warned. They are really bad.

[u]Summary:[/u] You are walking home one evening from your job(which you are apparently incompetent at), and find your way into the Audire, the lovely little Pub hidden away in an alley way. You meet all the potential [strike]daddies[/strike], I mean, gentlemen, and after introducing yourselves, you are able to pick one to continue a pretty decent storyline with.

ğŸŒ¸ All of these potential lovers are over the age of 40. 
 â €â €â €â €Hey, kink-shame all you want internet, but if you are all about that daddy
â €â €demographic, then you may enjoy at least one of these lovely lads. They all
â €â €have pretty solid and established careers and enjoy giving you attention. Who's
â €â €gonna say no to that? :^)

ğŸŒ¸ Music is not very annoying & each men feels different.
 â €â €â €â €I'm a sucker for the piano so I have nothing to complain about here. It's very fitting
â €â €â €to the nice, snazzy atmosphere of the pub. Each guy's story comes with their own
â €â €â €history and problems, and they aren't similar to one another which is nice. They will
â €â €â €even say things differently to you. No copy-paste laziness.

ğŸŒ¸ The men are, more or less, VERY well behaved compared to DL`s other VNs.
 â €â €â €â €After playing My Butler and Office Lovers, I must stress on how much BETTER 
â €â €â €these men are compared to those games! Most kept their hands at bay or at least
â €â €â €weren't outright overly touchy. Maybe too frank with their dialogue, but at least you
â €â €â €aren't getting molested within the first 5 minutes of meeting them.

ğŸ’” I enjoy older men, not old men! [i]/cough/ soichiro /cough[/i]
â €â €â €â €â €Playing through his storyline made me cringe and uncomfortable, but who am I
â €â €â €to shame those who enjoy raisins. I am not one of them. He was the most gentleman-
â €â €â €like out of them all, but I can't get over how [i]old[/i] he is.

ğŸ’” The art style is nice, however some instances make them really awkward and gross.
 â €â €â €â €â €If you have played any other game by them, you will notice each game comes
â €â €â € with a different art style. The art in this can be very nice, however a lot of scenes
â €â €â €just look soooo awkward and very bad. No offense to the artist who made 
â €â €â €these lovely men, but some features could have been made differently. 
â €â €â €In my opinion, at least.

I would recommend this game only if you are a fan of these types of games. The stories can be super cheesy, lame, and honestly really weird from time to time. Some of the things they say can be very sweet or over the top, and sometimes things go from 0 to 100 really fast! It`s not necessarily a bad thing, but I live for those wacky moments! If you do not like these kinds of games I don`t think it will be something you would like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062296741', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1590131172}
review:
I have to admit that I really don't enjoy the games made for mobile mainly, because it's written in a style that interrupts the story's flow because it was designed to be played in parts/small chapters. However, I admit that I completely fell in love with this one. Pub Encounter has it's own unique charme to it, not only because the men in this one are of a different age group, but also because of the whole bar setting and struggles with work life as well as struggles with other things adults have to deal with. 

I really love playing Otome games, loved playing them for years now, but I'm not getting any younger and so the typical young maiden MC might be something I still enjoy but don't feel too conected too anymore. This game was truely something I came to love, because it not only targets the younger Otome-Fans, but also those of already progressed ages, which is something there's far too little of out there at least for the West. 

I definitely recommend this game with all my heart and soul. I really had a good time with it.

But with this one... it really feels like the developers were trying to sell this too hard.  I dont feel the love and creativity most games at least try to keep along with the glitter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116668487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1531527169}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34863696-Some-Novel-%2528s%2529-called-Otome/?appid=787970] Follow me to see more reviews like this [/url]

[b]Type of Game: [/b] Visual Novel â€“ Reading & Choices
[b]Length: [/b] about 8h  
[b]Story: [/b] 5/10 (if you do not take it seriously) 
[b]Art: [/b] 6/10

Okay, so let's start with why I bought this game: I was reading a book about a relationship, where the girl and the guy have a huge age gap. The book was kind of weird (not because of the relationship per se; some parts of it were just wrong), but since it was told in the perspective of the older guy, it was never really explained, why he had fallen in love with the girl to begin with or what the girl thought about it. Thatâ€™s why I became curious about a game, which basically screamed at its players that itâ€™s about a girl, who likes older men.  

Therefore, I thought "Well, I know Dogenzaka Lab. I know that their translations are most of the time something to laugh at rather than to take serious (e.g The Men of Yoshiwara: Kikuya), but maybe I can find something in this game that counts as an explanation or idea, what the girl is thinking, when she gets into such a relationship." 

Long story short, I didn't find anything besides a bad translation, clichÃ©s and a lot of questionable behaviour. However, at least, I had quite a nice time reading this novel because at some point I took nothing quite serious (and ignored the fact that the age gap is hilariously huge).

Nevertheless, letâ€™s start at the beginning. Youâ€™re a cute girl in her 20's, who has a lousy boss and is in need of a drink. Therefore, you go into a "totally-not-suspicious" bar and have a drink with some men. These men are at least two times older than you (the youngest is 43) and everyone has fallen for you at first sight. "Not creepy at all", seems to think the heroine because she stays with them (having a good time apparently) and after that even comes back to the same bar on the next day. Normal behaviour, I guess.

Well, I'm a tough person, I won't be disgusted easily (even, if someone, who may be as old as my grand-dad flirts with the main character), so let's just skip to the things, which made even me think that this game went seriously too far.

Firstly, I am truly fascinated that there is none route [spoiler] besides the sequel of Hideaki's [/spoiler], which mentions the age gap as being somewhat strange, at least. 

Another great thing is that the developers didn't think it would be a wise choice to make the main characters at least a bit mature. I mean, they are guys in their 40's or 50's and act like they are the same age as the heroine. Seriously, why make a game about older men, if the older men are acting like 20-, maybe 25-years old guys? What's the point of that?! 

So that you know, what I am talking about, I am going to make a short introduction of every one of the characters the heroine can romanticize.

Ryunosuke:
Personally, I think this is the route, where I can at least understand the age gap. First of all [spoiler] he is the CEO of her favourite company, so they have a lot of common interests [/spoiler]. Then he is really shy and mysterious to her: She wants to help him and to know him better. She hasn't a lot of experience, so of course he seems amazing. Also, he acts really young [spoiler] because he is traumatized. Therefore, his personality doesnâ€™t feel forced. [/spoiler]

Mamoru:
He, actually, is a great example of what Iâ€™ve said before. He acts like a kid, a teenager, who is trying to seduce as many girls as possible â€“ a cheeky brat. [spoiler] Does he have a traumatic clichÃ© past? Yes, of course. [/spoiler]. However, thatâ€™s not going to work out, if the guy we are talking about is 46-years old. Honestly, itâ€™s not even about the age gap anymore, he is just sometimes plainly creepy [spoiler] because e.g. he tries to get the main character drunk and then takes her back to her home, with a clear intentionâ€¦ of doing nothing (yay). [/spoiler] Nevertheless, I canâ€™t agree with some people, who told that his route was the worst. There were other routes, where Iâ€™d call the police. 

Hideaki:
I said Mamoru was mentally about 20 years old, so, if we consider that, Hideaki has to be about 16-18 years old. [spoiler] He has a traumatic past. Sure thing, but I wonder how they achieved to combine the impossible: A cheerful police officer, who is kind of rough, but at the same time acts like an angsty teen, who canâ€™t get over a traumatic experience, cries a lot and doesnâ€™t have any self-confidence. Quite a paradox. [/spoiler] At least in this route her PARENTS (not she, not him, who werenâ€™t even questioning anything) werenâ€™t okay with their relationship because of the age gap. Thank you. Someone finally noticed it. 

Yorihisa:
Here I started to feel slightly concerned [spoiler] because this guy is 51[/spoiler]. His route told me that it was right to feel so. I think he was crossing the line of whatâ€™s acceptable in more than one way. [spoiler]Letâ€™s see: Firstly, he kind of sexually harasses the main character by forcing her to sit on his lap. Plus, the deal. The deal, which would be A REALLY GOOD idea, if this guy WASNâ€™T AN OLD MAN. It's a â€˜gameâ€™, where the heroine trying to make Yorihisa fall in love with her, while Yorihisa does the same (allowing him to harass her as much as he wants.) in order to make him write a new romance novel because he is, shocking discovery, her favourite author. It gets even better. After being harassed, the main character even starts to like him. And everyone else SUPPORTS IT?! [/spoiler]

Souchiro:
Here I am, by now feeling completely disgusted. Yay! Would you start a romance with your grandfatherâ€™s friend? Well, I sure wouldnâ€™t. Our heroine though thinks itâ€™s normal and surprisingly Souchiro does as well. I just canâ€™t find any words to describe this.

I mean, Iâ€™m really open-minded, whether you like older guys or not, whether itâ€™s the same gender or not. However, this game is treating it as an every-day occurrence; it doesnâ€™t even try to explain it. It just says: â€œOh, Souchiro is so gentle. Iâ€™m starting to fall for him.â€ What about him being as old as your grandparent is (Yorihisa is as old as her father is)? 

Honestly, I would be really disappointed in this game, if I had been hung up on the idea to find out what a girl may think, when she falls in love with people, who are as old as her parents or grandparents.

However, at some point I was just reading it because it was rather hilarious and just so unrealistic that, well, I stopped taking serious, what these people were doing or saying. And then it was pretty much okay to bear.

Nevertheless, some routes were still not okay because it was either just wrong or kind of disgusting. I mean, most of them, would be acceptable, if either the characters were younger, or the story wasnâ€™t centred on their â€œsufferingâ€ and â€œpastâ€, but instead on the difficulty of building a relationship, while having a huge age gap. It could even have been a really good story.

Apart from that, the writing is bad, the translation is often wrong and sometimes chunks of dialogue repeat in every route. However, I think itâ€™s good that the writing is bad because it really helps to not take this game any serious.

Somehow, I still like some characters and Yorihisaâ€™s story, but if you start looking at the age, everything becomes either creepy or just badly designed. 

In conclusion, I donâ€™t really recommend buying this game, if you want something serious. Something new. Something that isnâ€™t there for just passing time. Something you can think about for hours and contemplate on.

Because this game is just a funny read, if you donâ€™t take anything serious like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1530834418}
review:
So this is an otome revolving around the protagonist dating one of five older gentlemen. It is an intriguing concept, and if what one of my old Spanish teachers was correct... maybe they might have reached a maturity level equal to the lady protag...

No such luck in most cases, actually. Most of the male leads act similar to those in other Dogenzaka Lab games, meaning they seem to be more in their early 20's, than in their 30's or 40's.

Still, the characters are decently written (maybe aside from the protag, who suffers from otome-protagonist-syndrome). And the plot is decent.

Still would suggest getting this on discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206719825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1526215690}
review:
I really liked this game, even though you can't really influence it at all. You can only get a good end, dating the one you wanted. The problems on the way were quite interesting. Blackmailing, throwing stones, yada yada... It was really interesting until the very end. 
Personally, old men are not my type, but I loved the gap moe! Being mature but still very adorable was too much for my young heart! 
I should also mention that the sex scenes came out of nowhere. I didn't expect the game to have something like that and almost spilled my drink! haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198256398377', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1609376557}
review:
These kind of games are always a guilty pleasure to play and I've played a lot. While I do enjoy playing these Sim type games I tend to feel a little odd when I pick a younger guy for my MC since i am a little older myself and when I get the chance in the games I tend to go for the older guys.

And I have to say this was rather perfect for me, I had a lot of fun going for each guy [ even though I am a little sad when my files got erased.]

Playing this game was like ridding a roller coaster, you could really feel the emotion behind everything and it was nice playing a game where you're not seeing the same shit over and over again, plus the perv in me liked 18+ games.

I enjoyed this game a lot and I do reccomended it since it is so rare to see a Sim date have older men to romance.

review: ok this game is amazing with amazing characters. ive play all the routes but one i cant decide which i like more right now but i do admit that one of them made me cry near the end. this is the second game i think i played by this company and i just am amazed by how well they make their games, although they are some spelling and grammar mistakes here and there but its not bad to the point where it is not understandable, you know what they were trying to say or do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126859889', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2029, 'last_played': 1511760157}
review: This is a very good game from Dogenzaka Lab. The characters all interesting and diverse, they all have a good group dynamic as well which I love in otome games. Of the Dogenzaka Lab games I've played, this one is by far my favorite. The age difference between the protag and the love interests is a little strange at first, but it's pretty easy to ignore after a while. The art is standard, the writing is mostly good, it's a shame it's not voice acted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128572588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1515555821}
review:
I bought this game on a whim because I had already played a pigeon dating sim so a dating sim where you woo old men was the next logical choice in dating sims. 

So far I haven't been disappointed with the game, and it's a game I like to play when I need to perk up my mood. If you want a dating sim where things get steamy this is it. You get a choice of men aged 40 to 70 (maybe, I actually don't know. They don't express their ages but they look between 40 and 70). Now you might be sitting there like, "Why would I want to play a game where I romance an old man?" Why wouldn't you? The characters are pretty great and the stories are a bit cliche but it's everything you'd want in a dating sim. There's even a random, unromanceable character who really just seems like he's just an old guy in the bar to get that hot goss about the main character and whatever man she's pursuing. It's fantastic! 

9/10 would recommend.
(Although I recommend buying it on sale)
